column4: is there a webpage for people that had ubuntu working fine with wireless until they upgraded to 10.04?
is there a webpage for people that had ubuntu working fine with wireless until they upgraded to 10.04?
why do you guys release 10.04 when it doesnt work?
It is working just fine for me, as does it for quite a lot of people.
perhaps some more info would be useful... will it not start? Does it not detect something? Don't you like the interface?
and if you try to start it via command line, will it load or error out?
gnome-network-manager: command not found
hmm, a sec ... checking for the correct command
you're referring to the default network manager of the gnome desktop, correct? Then it's the network manager you're referring to specifically?
yes
is the applet running in the right top of your screen? Run in a console ==> nm-applet (without the arrows, ofc)
no, it's not running
and if you run nm-applet, what is the output?
it loads in the upper right hand corner, and shows it as connected after i click connect, but pages wont load
and by pages I assume you mean a general webpage? How are you connected to the internet, via a cable or via wireless? Can you try to ping google.com for example?
pings come back fine
then your web should be working just fine. Which page are you trying to show? Would it be possible this site is down?
google.com, yahoo.com, msn.com
hmm ... yeah those sites are up. Have you tried a different browser? It would appear your web connection is working just fine.
yes i have
then i'm afraid i'm at a loss. Considering that ping works but your browser doesn't, I don't see where the problem lies.
